Class Lift

  • java.lang.Object
    • Lift
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    computeChangeTime
    public class Lift
extends java.lang.Object
implements computeChangeTime
    The Lift class represents a lift that goes from one floor to another.

    An instance from the class Lift has 12 variables:

    • An unique identificator attributed permanently.
    • A list of Person who are in the lift.
    • An activity time which symbolizes the amount of time a lift has been activated.
    • A floor which is the floor where the elevator is stationned at the moment.
    • A maximal amount of Person carriable by the lift. This amount cannot be changed.
    • A direction : either the lift is going up or down or stay still.
    • The speed of the lift, the amountof time they take to go from one floor to the up or down floor.
    • A list of two lists which each contains the next floors the lift is going to visit according to the Person already in the lift.
    • A boolean variable that tell us if the lift has its doors open or not.
    • The amount of time the lift has its doors open.
    • The moment when its doors open.
    • The moment when its doors close.
    See Also:
    Person

                       int out,
                       int in)

        Specified by:
        computeTime in interface computeChangeTime

      • peopleOutIn

        public java.util.ArrayList<Person> peopleOutIn​(java.util.ArrayList<Person> out,
                                               java.util.ArrayList<Person> in,
                                               int startTime)
        Deals with all the events that can happen when the doors of a lift are open. It resets the activity time of the lift and his direction. If it returns a list of Person, it means that the lift was crowded and they will have to wait for another one.
        Parameters:
        out - The list of Person who are going out of the lift.
        in - The list of Person who are going in the lift.
        startTime - The moment when the lift starts to open its doors.
        Returns:
        ArrayList<Person>
        See Also:
        Person

      • stay

        public void stay()
        The lift doesn't do anything (load,unload or move). The time just passes by... It increases the activity time of the lift by 1 time unity.

      • move

        public void move​(int nextFloor)
        The lift moves to a floor. It sets the currentFloor of the lift to the floor passed in parameter. It updates the activity time of the lift (the amount of time is proportionnal to the number of floor it has to travel).
        Parameters:
        nextFloor - The floor towards which the lift is heading.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
